content:
主要研究方向为城市交通系统建模、动态交通分配、最优控制和非线性控制、随机动态规划、自适应动态规划、强化学习与智能交通系统应用、数据挖掘等，在国际著名SCI/SSCI期刊上发表了二十余篇论文，超过十篇文章发表在交通研究的顶级期刊上，并被评为期刊最热门文章和引用最多的文章之一。
现任中科院工程与技术类二区SCI期刊《Transportmetrica B: Transport Dynamics》副主编，任多本国际著名期刊如《Automatica》、《Transportation Science》、《Transportation Re-search Part B、 C、 E》、《IEEE Transactions on Neural Networksand L-earning Systems》、《IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems》、《International Journal of Robust and Nonlinear Control》‏审稿人。与国内外相关领域的学者保持着良好的合作关系，科研交流密切。
曾获得第十四届香港交通研究学会国际会议优秀学生论文一等奖(第二名)，第17届香港交通学会国际会议最佳博士论文与论文奖和Gordon Newell纪念奖，2018年文章获得IEEE ITSC(IEEE Intelligent Transportation Systems Conference)年度最佳论文奖提名。实践方面，曾作为主要研究人员为泰国高速公路管理局开发了智能交通规划与高速公路监测与控制系统；主持国家科技支撑计划子课题，参与开发高速公路重大交通事件快速发现与定位系统(与社会事件检测和异常发现直接相关)等；2019年承担国家重点研发计划子课题，研究方向为车路协同网络交通态势演化规律及可靠性，解析网络交通流演化规律及态势，与车辆供需关系研究相关；同年，承担了国家自然科学基金联合基金中心项目(重大)重点课题子课题，基于大数据的智慧交通基础理论与关键技术，研究城市交通出行规律挖掘与演化分析(与城市居民出行规律挖掘直接相关)。2018年，申请人与滴滴出行创建科研合作计划，基于历史和实时数据建立公共交通车辆和出行供需之间的车辆调度模型，提出非固定站点的车辆实时鲁棒调度策略和车辆调度建议。
此外，参加和指导的团队曾参与多个国内外数据挖掘竞赛，且均获佳绩：团队在2018年KDD全球数据挖掘与知识发现竞赛中，在3800多支参赛队伍中获得第三名以及最佳长期预测奖第二名的成绩；同年团队在中国华录杯·开放数据创新应用大赛创意赛中获得大赛第二名。2017年中国计算机学会(CCF)授予“优秀指导教师奖”(指导的队伍获得“企业经营风险预测赛”第一名)，2017年全球数据挖掘与知识发现竞赛(2017 KDD CUP)季军；中国计算机学会的国家电网“客户用电异常行为”第一名；以及2017年“智慧中国杯”全国大数据创新应用大赛(共三个赛题)交通数据挖掘赛第一名和金融数据挖掘赛第一名，教育数据挖掘赛题第二名；“2016携程云海”数据挖掘竞赛冠军。
summary: 主要研究方向为城市交通系统建模、动态交通分配、最优控制和非线性控制、随机动态规划、自适应动态规划、强化学习与智能交通系统应用、数据挖掘等，在
title: 钟任新

title: 张景
詹志

summary: To better capture the traffic flow propagation and to adapt to the fast time-varying demand, the state-dependent travel time function is integrated into the MFD dynamics as an endogenous time-varying delay.
tags: Simultaneous Route Choice And Departure Time Choice
title: A dynamic user equilibrium model for multi-region macroscopic fundamental diagram systems with time-varying delays

summary: The neuro-dynamic controller is tested for the two-regional MFD system. The results confirm that the neuro-dynamic controller can regulate the traffic states converge to the desired uncongested equilibrium.
title: A neuro-dynamic programming approach for perimeter control of two urban regions with macroscopic fundamental diagrams

summary: In this paper, we consider the spatial-temporal data modeling problem with large number of time instants and moderate number of locations.
title: Recursive Implementation of Gaussian Process Regression for Spatial-Temporal Data Modeling

summary: This paper proposes a double time-scale model to capture the day-to-day evolution along with the within-day variability of travel time.
title: Modeling double time-scale travel time processes with application to assessing the resilience of transportation systems

summary: This paper develops a multiclass multilane cell transmission model (CTM) to simulate traffic flow dynamics mixed with CAVs and RHVs by capturing the interaction between the two vehicle classes
title: Multiclass multilane model for freeway traffic mixed with connected automated vehicles and regular human-piloted vehicles

summary: This paper presents an optimal control framework to model dynamic user equilibria (DUE) with simultaneous route choice behavior and departure time choice for general urban networks.
title: An optimal control framework for multi-region macroscopic fundamental diagram systems with time delay, considering route choice and departure time choice

summary: The main objective of this paper is to explore a new robust perimeter control framework for dynamic traffic networks with parameter uncertainty (on the MFD) and exogenous disturbance induced by travel demand.
title: Robust perimeter control for two urban regions with macroscopic fundamental diagrams——A control-Lyapunov function approach

summary: The aim of this research was to investigate the performance of simulated traffic data for real-time crash prediction when loop detector stations are distant from the actual crash location.
title: Predicting Imminent Crash Risk with Simulated Traffic from Distant Sensors
A probabilistic sensitivity analysis guided cross entropy method for efficient calibration of traffic models

summary: This paper analyses the performance of motorway control strategies subject to real-time flow measurement and modeling uncertainties. The control strategies are derived and tested on the cell transmission model with which global optimal solutions can be derived through solving linear programs.
title: Control strategies for dynamic motorway traffic subject to flow uncertaintie

summary: In this article, we investigate such effect and propose some appropriate boundary conditions to ensure that the MFD dynamics are well-defined.
title: Boundary conditions and behavior of the macroscopic fundamental diagram based network traffic dynamics A control systems perspective

summary: This study proposes an online travel time prediction model with emphasis on capturing the effects of anomalies. The model divides a path into short links. A Functional Principal Component Analysis (FPCA) framework is adopted to forecast link travel times based on historical data and real-time measurements.
title: Forecasting journey time distribution with consideration to abnormal traffic conditions

summary: This paper presents an open-closed-loop iterative learning control (ILC) approach, which includes a feedforward ILC part and a feedback control part.
title: An open-closed-loop iterative learning control approach for nonlinear switched systems with application to freeway traffic control

tags: Simultaneous Route Choice And Departure Time Choice
title: The effect of connected automated vehicles on macroscopic fundamental diagram of freeway traffic

summary: This paper presents a set of optimal control formulations for maximising bus service reliability through deriving optimal adjustments on signal timings.
title: Multi-objective optimal control formulations for bus service reliability with traffic signals

summary: This paper presents and analyses an adaptive control strategy for motorway traffic which considers real time variations in traffic flow.
title: Adaptive Ramp Control for Motorways and its Performance Analysis with Respect to Traffic Variability

summary: This study proposes an online travel time prediction model with emphasis on capturing the effects caused by anomalies. The model divides a path into short links.
title: An Online Travel Time Prediction Model Based on Functional Data Analysis
A real-time travel time prediction model based on functional principal component analysis

summary: A novel mesoscopic multilane model is proposed to enable simultaneous simulation of mandatory and discretionary lane-changing behaviors to realistically capture multilane traffic dynamics.
title: Modeling the impacts of mandatory and discretionary lane-changing maneuvers

summary: 短介绍
title: Bus Arrival Time Prediction Based on Support Vector Regression with Bayesian Correction

summary: This contribution puts forward a Cross-Entropy Method (CEM) based approach to identify parameters of deterministic car-following models under noisy data by formulating it as a stochastic optimization problem.
title: A cross-entropy method and probabilistic sensitivity analysis framework for calibrating microscopic traffic models

summary: 短介绍
title: Calibration of microscopic traffic model cross entropy method and probability sensitivity analysis

summary: This study presents an automatic calibration method to estimate the parameters of a fundamental diagram through a dynamic approach.
title: A dynamic user equilibrium model for multi-region macroscopic fundamental diagram systems with time-varying delays
A fusion method based on functional principle component analysis to predict real-time travel time distribution

summary: The modified cell transmission model (MCTM) is formulated as a linear complementarity system (LCS) in this paper.
title: Linear complementarity system approach to macroscopic freeway traffic modelling uniqueness and convexity

summary: A stability condition of the proposed model is obtained using the theory of linear systems.
title: Modelling car-following behaviour with lateral separation and overtaking expectation
Steady state analysis of day-to-day traffic disequilibrium dynamics under demand management and supply regulations

summary: This paper investigates optimal decision-making for traffic management under demand and supply uncertainties by stochastic dynamic programming.
title: Optimal and robust strategies for freeway traffic management under demand and supply uncertainties an overview and general theory

summary: This paper proposes a framework for evaluating the distributions of stochastic dynamic link travel time and journey time as well as assessing the journey time reliability.
title: Dynamic stochastic journey time estimation and reliability analysis using stochastic cell transmission model Algorithm and case studies

summary: The independent assumption in the original SCTM framework may prevent the model from a broad range of applications, e.g., short-term traffic state prediction. In this paper, the SCTM framework is extended to consider the spatial-temporal correlation of traffic flow and to support short-term traffic state prediction.
title: Short-Term Traffic State Prediction Based on Temporal–Spatial Correlation

summary: In this paper, we investigate theoretical constructions and properties of three interrelated travel demand management measures including marginal cost pricing, access control, and pollution charge under dynamic traffic assignment framework.
title: Dynamic marginal cost, access control, and pollution charge: a comparison of bottleneck and whole link models

summary: This article extends the stochastic cell transmission model (SCTM) to simulate traffic flows on networks with stochastic demand and supply.
title: Stochastic cell transmission model for traffic network with demand and supply uncertainties

summary: This paper investigates a traffic volume control scheme for a dynamic traffic network model which aims to ensure that traffic volumes on specified links do not exceed preferred levels.
title: Dynamic user equilibrium with side constraints for a traffic network Theoretical development and numerical solution algorithm
